elements.title: Standard Assessment Procedure
elements.description: Guidance on how a home's energy performance is calculated using the Standard Assessment Procedure (SAP) methodology, which underpins the Energy Performance Certificate (EPC). The new SAP / RdSAP 11 (scoped by [Etude](https://www.etude.co.uk/news/the-future-of-sap-calculations/) and [brought forward by BRE](https://www.edie.net/uk-to-revamp-methodology-that-measures-energy-performance-of-uk-homes/)) will come into force in 2025, alongside the Future Homes Standard update of the Building Regulations.

elements.title: Investor Confidence Project Europe
elements.description: The Investor Confidence Project Europe unlocks access to financing for the building, industry, district energy and street lighting markets by standardizing how energy efficiency projects are developed, documented and measured.

elements.title: Energy Star portfolio manager
elements.description: Portfolio Manager is an interactive resource management tool that enables you to benchmark the energy use of any type of building, all in a secure online environment.

elements.title: MCS
elements.description: MCS is a standards organisation. They create and maintain standards that allows for the certification of products, installers and their installations. In [Nov 2021](https://www.solarpowerportal.co.uk/news/mcs_launches_battery_installation_standard_in_bid_to_provide_one_stop_shop) they have launched [MIS 3012](https://mcscertified.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/MIS-3012_Battery-Storage-Systems-V0.1.pdf) the first battery installation standard, detailing requirements for MCS certified installers

elements.title: NABERS: New energy rating scheme for offices available in UK
elements.description: NABERS UK was introduced in November 2020 to help address performance gaps in current energy efficiency ratings, managed by the Building Research Establishment (BRE) the scheme replicates the well-established NABERS Australian rating scheme, in the [news from edie](https://www.edie.net/news/6/NABERS--New-energy-rating-scheme-for-offices-available-in-UK/), Oct 2021

elements.title: DNV
elements.description: Giant group DNV are the independent expert in assurance and risk management, headquartered in Oslo with operations in more than 100 countries. They have a [part of the business](https://www.dnv.com/power-renewables/services/testing/battery-storage.html) dedicated to storage. In [December 2020](https://www.dnv.com/news/dnv-gl-performs-technical-due-diligence-for-gore-street-energy-storage-fund-s-acquisition-of-anesco-s-81-mw-uk-operational-battery-storage-portfolio-192425), selected by Gore Street Capital to undertake a range of technical due diligence services on an 81 MW operational battery storage portfolio.

elements.title: Soft landings public sector
elements.description: Soft Landings delivers improvements to the performance of buildings once the keys have been handed over, Central Government launched their own version, Government Soft Landings (GSL) in 2016.

elements.title: BSRIA Soft landings
elements.description: Soft Landings is a building delivery process which runs through the project, from inception to completion and beyond, to ensure all decisions made during the project are based on improving operational performance of the building and meeting the client’s expectations

elements.title: The green deal
elements.description: Green deal (expired 2014) [link](https://www.gov.uk/green-deal-energy-saving-measures)

elements.title: Avieco - formerly Carbon Smart
elements.description: Avieco / Carbon Smart help businesses take the sustainability steps that make sense to them

elements.title: Delta EE
elements.description: Delta-EE provides research to the new energy industry through research services and bespoke consultancy projects, depending on the individual client's needs.

elements.title: SENSEI
elements.description: SENSEI combines pay-for-performance (P4P) arrangements with the Energy Performance Contracting (EPC) model and engages in negotiation games with preliminary stakeholders.

elements.title: BREEAM
elements.description: BREEAM world’s leading sustainability assessment method + certification for masterplanning projects, infrastructure and buildings.

elements.title: stroma certification
elements.description: stroma certification for epc, gas, etc...

elements.title: microgeneration
elements.description: microgeneration quality certification supported by BEIS

elements.title: EPC register
elements.description: energy performance certificate (private residence only?) EPC register there’s also a data set here: [London domestic efficiency by boroughs](https://data.london.gov.uk/dataset/domestic-energy-efficiency-ratings-borough)

elements.title: TERRE
elements.description: TERRE is the Trans European Replacement Reserves Exchange. From what I understood companies like Flexitricity or any other PPA can use this protocol to provide demand side response with a 15' cycle time. Have no idea how they implement it though.

elements.title: Streamlined energy and carbon reporting - SECR
elements.description: Streamlined energy and carbon reporting - SECR released Oct '17 and updated mid '18 gives guidelines for mandatory carbon reporting framework for UK big businesses, as well as directions for energy efficiency

elements.title: ESOS
elements.description: ESOS is a mandatory energy assessment scheme for organisations in the UK that meet the qualification criteria established to implement Article 8 (4 to 6) of the [EU Energy Efficiency Directive (2012/27/EU)](http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2012:315:0001:0056:EN:PDF)

elements.title: Energy Managers Association
elements.description: Energy Managers Association aims to: Improve the standing of the Energy Management profession and those working within it, Establish best-practice in Energy Management, Put Energy Management at the heart of British business
